QuestionStatement: Assume that the required reserve ratio is 10 percent, banks keep no excess reserves, and borrowers deposit all loans made by banks.  Suppose you have $100 in cash at home and decide to deposit it in your checking account.  As a result of your deposit, the money supply can increase by a maximum of
Which of the following occurs as investment becomes more responsive to changes in the interest rate?
AnswerChoices: Monetary policy becomes more effective at changing real gross domestic product
Fiscal policy becomes more effective at changing real gross domestic product
Monetary policy becomes more effective at changing interest rates
Fiscal policy becomes more effective at changing interest rates
There is no change in the effectiveness of either monetary or fiscal policy

QuestionStatement: Which of the following is true about change in tax rates, changes in the level of government expenditures, and changes in the money supply?
AnswerChoices: They are tools of discretionary fiscal policy
They have different lag times between implementation of a policy and its effects on aggregate demand
They are favored equally by both classical and Keynesian economists to fine-tune the economy
All are controlled by the Federal reserve system

QuestionStatement: In the narrowest definition of money, M1, savings accounts are excluded because they are
AnswerChoices: Not insured by federal deposit insurance
Available from financial institutions other than banks

QuestionStatement: For which of the following sets of unemployment and inflation rates will a central bank be most reluctant to increase the rate of growth in the money supply?

A contraction in the money supply will most likely change the nominal interest rate and aggregate demand in which of the following ways in the short run?  Nominal          Interest Rate    Aggregate Demanda.      Increase            Decreaseb.      Increase            Increasec.      Increase            Not changed.      Decrease            Decreasee.      Decrease            Increase
If the economy is in a severe recession, which of the following policy actions is most appropriate?
AnswerChoices: Keeping the money supply constant and reducing budget deficits
Decreasing government spending and taxes by the same amount
Increasing both the money supply and government spending
Increasing both the federal funds rate and taxes
Decreasing the money supply and increasing taxes

An increase in government spending will affect the demand for money and nominal interest rates in which of the following ways?  Demand                     Nominal                  for Money                Interest Ratesa.      Increase            Increaseb.      Increase            Decreasec.      Increase            Indeterminated.      Decrease            Increasee.      Decrease            Decrease
Which of the following policies, if appropriately sized, would provide expansion during a recession with the smallest change in interest rates?
AnswerChoices: An open-market purchase of government securities by the central bank and a decrease in the federal funds rate
An open-market sale of government securities by the central bank and an increase in the federal funds rate
A decrease in taxes and an open-market purchase of government securities by the central bank
An increase in government spending and an open-market sale of government securities by the central bank
An increase in taxes and an increase in the federal funds rate

QuestionStatement: Assume that the public holds part of its money in cash and the rest in checking accounts. If the central bank lowers the reserve requirement from 16 percent to 8 percent, the money supply will
Potential gross domestic product will decrease under which of the following conditions?
AnswerChoices: The growth rate of the population increases more rapidly than the growth rate of gross domestic product.
Nominal gross domestic product increases more than real gross domestic product
The natural rate of unemployment decreases
The country’s annual depreciation is greater than its annual gross investment
The monetary authorities adopt an easy monetary policy

QuestionStatement: Which of the following actions by the Federal Reserve of the United States increases the money supply?
AnswerChoices: Buying government bonds on the open market
Selling government bonds on the open market

An increase in the price level will most likely cause which of the following?
AnswerChoices: A leftward shift of the aggregate demand curve
An increase in the demand for money
An increase in the real interest rate
A decrease in the nominal interest rate

QuestionStatement: If aggregate demand is growing faster than long- run aggregate supply, the Federal Reserve is most likely to
AnswerChoices: sell securities on the open market

QuestionStatement: Which of the following is true of the opportunity cost of holding cash?
AnswerChoices: It is represented by the value of the dollar
It is equal to the price level
It decreases as the price level rises
It increases as the interest rate rises

QuestionStatement: In the long run, an increase in aggregate demand due to an expansion in the money supply will increase
AnswerChoices: nominal output but not the price level
nominal output and the price level
real output but not the price level
